conclusion: Incident angle is 60 degrees and light is parallel to incident light after exiting.
Angle of incidence equals angle of refraction, both are 60 degrees.
Angle of incidence equals angle of reflection, both are 60 degrees.
Angle between incident light and normal to circular surface is 60 degrees.
Angle between incident light and radius of circle is 30 degrees.
Distance between OP is R / sqrt(3).
